name: InterContinental de la Ville

reviews.text: Our four night stay at the De La Ville IC was delightful, with a prime location right next to the Hassler, at the top of the Spanish Steps. Although our room wasn't large, it was well-appointed, with a balcony that extended the length of the room and bathroom, overlooking the hotel courtyard, which was quiet and serene. We were on the 6 floor and just passed the elevators was an outdoor roof area with tables and chairs and a panorama view of the city. The staff and concierge were friendly and helpful. We are IC members and turned in points for one free night, which really helped against the euro. A wonderful buffet breakfast was also included with our membership. IC membership is a great deal, offering several nice perks, along with lovely hotels in prime locations throughout the world.
reviews.title: Delightful hotel!
Loved the hotel
reviews.text: This hotel has the best location in town. The rooms were quite adequate and the personnel (especially the friendly concierge Mr. Oddis and Mr. Pino) helped us a great deal. The food there is also quite good. Worth the money. Join the Priority Club (Intercontinental) and get one free week end night.

reviews.title: Superb hotel
reviews.text: My wife ,my five year old son,and I stayed there in late

reviews.title: Great Location, But Average Room
reviews.text: May. The staff was great and room was fine. We had to eat

reviews.title: Good location- bit over priced
reviews.text: dinner at the hotel one night because our son was ill.
This was our first time in Rome. What an amazing city! We were there for 10 days. We can’t say enough about how wonderful our experience was while staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: An Outstanding Hotel
Enjoyable location and hotel
reviews.text: The location was so convenient. It’s at the top of the Spanish Steps and within walking distance of everything. Our room was great and overlooked the courtyard.

Best of all, the staff really cares about their guests and it really shows. Giacomo Pica, Front Office Manager, and Nicola and Pino at the concierge desk went above and beyond the call of duty. They made my wife and I feel very special.
reviews.title: Great Location for sightseeing and very clean and comfortable.
The hotel is a real find and a jewel in the centre of this wonderful city
reviews.text: When in Rome, everyone should stay at this hotel. Great hotel, location and staff. We’ll be back.

Just returned from Rome and we were pleased with the hotel. We were a little concerned about arriving after midnight , but Pino, the concierege, arranged transportation and everything went like clockwork. We looked forward to breakfast in the mornings and our room was fresh and clean. Being located at the top of the Spanish Steps is a great plus, as you get some fresh air and escape a little of the smog/fumes that accumulate in the lower streets. We considered staying closer to the Piazza Navona, but to be honest, we are glad that we didn't - again fumes. I note this because my husband and I are great allergy sufferers and found that we were very comfortable where we stayed. The area of the Spanish Steps is definite walking distance to all locations as we walked to most of the central areas of Rome and to Vatican City (about 20 min). Our only complaint was being initially placed in a room on a smoking floor when we had specifically asked for a non-smoking room and confirmed that. Also, we were booked into a deluxe room and the first room was not. We merely rang the front desk and they showed us 2 other rooms (this is at 1AM), one of which was exactly what we had booked. Once I showed the reservation details of the room specs from the internet, we had no problem. We were also given a 4 PM checkout. We would definitely stay here again. Overall a very good place!
reviews.title: Embarrassingly Substandard

reviews.text: My 14-year old son and I just returned from Italy, and the Intercontinental De La Ville was our last leg of the trip.
reviews.title: Nice, but less than expected

reviews.text: As stated in prior reviews, the location of the hotel can't be beat.
reviews.title: Helped make my trip perfect
Intercontinental (near Spanish Staps)
reviews.text: We stayed in an executive suite, which in my opinion was not worth the price. The executive suites do not have 2 bathrooms as stated, they have one. Maybe some of the other ones do, but not the one that I was in.

Check-in is at 1:00. When I arrived I was told that my room would not be ready until at least 4:30 because the current guest had a guaranteed late check-out. We were, however, placed in a temporary room to rest and freshen up. The temporary room was a standard room. It was smaller than the executive suite, but lovely.
reviews.title: Intercontinental Rome

reviews.text: The hotel is nice, and it is comfortable. I would stay there again, but would save the money and stay in a standard room.
reviews.title: Very nice - great breakfast buffet

reviews.text: Just returned from a long weekend at this hotel and, all in all, we were very satisfied. Sean Connery and Valentino both stay there when in town so they must be doing something right! Great location, very professional staff, nice rooms.
reviews.title: Mingle with Sean Connery! A very nice hotel

reviews.text: The building is from the 15th century so many of the rooms are quite small; each room literally has a different shape. My bathroom was a sort of triangle. When I arrived I was shown to a room with a lovely private terrace in the courtyard but, as it was only large enough to accommodate two single beds and not much else, I asked for a larger room, as a friend was to join me the next day. I must say that the manager, Giacomo, really bent over backwards to please me and eventually gave my friend and I two single rooms for the price of a double!
reviews.title: Steps from Spanish Steps

reviews.text: Tasteful room furnishings, a choice of soft and hard pillows on the bed, nice bath products, very plush terry robes and towels, a relatively good choice of TV channels. What I would have appreciated in addition were iron and ironing board, tea and coffee maker and free radio (if you wanted to listen to music, you had to pay for it). Toll free calls made with a phone card are billed 2.50 Euros per call.
reviews.title: Ideal base for your Rome trip

reviews.text: I ordered room service twice: the second time was fantastic with a delicious salad and assorted breads, all on a table with wheels, the first time was a disaster as I arrived at the hotel very late and ordered after 11pm. They brought me a tray with a tiny chicken sandwich on wonder bread with a few wisps of chicken for 15 Euros, which I immediately sent back. Do NOT expect good food after 11 pm as there is no cook available. The fitness club is very basic and I didn’t use it. There is one of the largest fitness clubs in the world about 15 minutes from the hotel with everything you can imagine.
reviews.title: Grazie!
Fabulous
reviews.text: We got our rooms through Priceline for the bargain price of $189.00 per night. I would most definitely go back.

aka: Intercontinental De La Ville Hotel Rome
description: There s no better place to begin your Eternal City experience than InterContinental De La Ville Roma. Our location at the top of the Spanish Steps is the ideal base for shopping, sightseeing and attending cultural events. Within a short radius are Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum, Via Condotti, Piazza di Spagna and the Borghese Gallery and Museum.
